books.description: This guide is for anyone who knows some Javascript but would like a quick intro to its advanced features.

books.title: Hard Rock CoffeeScript

books.description: Community driven Javascript and jQuery book.

books.title: Developing Backbone.js Applications
books.author: Addy Osmani
books.description: In this book we will explore MVC theory and how to build applications using Backbone's models, views, collections and routers.

books.title: Javascript Guide
books.author: Mozilla Developer Network
books.description: JavaScript is a cross-platform, object-based scripting language. This guide explains everything you need to know about using JavaScript.

books.title: JavaScript For Cats
books.author: Max Ogden
books.description: An in-browser interactive introductory programming text designed for cats. Humans are probably also capable of following along.

books.title: Javascript Design Patterns
books.author: Addy Osmani
books.description: In this book we will explore applying both classical and modern design patterns to the JavaScript programming language

books.title: Writing Modular JavaScript With AMD, CommonJS & ES Harmony
books.author: Addy Osmani
books.description: In this article, we're going to look at three formats for writing modular JavaScript: AMD, CommonJS and proposals for the next version of JavaScript, Harmony.

books.title: The little Book on CoffeeScript
books.author: Alex MacCaw
books.description: This book is designed to help you learn CoffeeScript, understand best practices and start building awesome client side applications.

books.title: Master Space and time with JavaScript - The Basics
books.author: Noel Rappin
books.description: [NOTE : Free registration needed]. A four book series aimed at developers who have a basic knowledge of JavaScript but who need to learn about newer tools and practices.

books.title: HTML Canvas Deep Dive
books.author: Josh Marinacci
books.description: For those who allready know JavaScript basics and wants to learn HTML Canvas.

books.title: Dynamisez vos sites web avec JavaScript !
books.author: Le Site du Zero
books.description: [IN FRENCH] Le tutorial référence en francais pour apprendre le JavaScript. Culte !

books.title: Testing with CoffeeScript
books.author: Jack Franklin
books.description: [NOTE : Download needed]. You will be guided through the creation of a shopping cart system. You’ll learn about using and testing jQuery code, writing more idiomatic CoffeeScript and building a well thought out and structured, complex JavaScript application.

books.title: Dive into HTML 5
books.author: Mark Pilgrim
books.description: A community ebook to discover HTML5 best practices and experiment with Javascript.

books.title: Javascript Garden
books.author: Ivo Wetzel
books.description: A collection of documentation about the most quirky parts of JavaScript.

books.title: The little MongoDB book
books.author: Karl Seguin
books.description: Discover NoSQL with MongoDB and commons Javascript usage patterns.

books.title: Mixu's Node book
books.author: Mikito Takada
books.description: A comprehensive and interesting NodeJS overview covering many aspects in details.

books.title: Single page apps in depth
books.author: Mikito Takada
books.description: Learn the best practices for implementing single page web apps.

books.title: Mastering NodeJS
books.author: TJ Holowaychuk
books.description: In Mastering Node we will discover how to write high concurrency web servers,…

books.title: JS The Right Way
books.author: William Oliveira
books.description: An easy-to-read, quick reference for JS best practices, accepted coding standards, and links around the Web.

books.title: Programming Windows 8 Apps
books.author: Devon Musgrave
books.description: [NOTE : Download needed]This book is about writing Windows Store apps using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.

books.title: CoffeeScript Cookbook
books.author: Multiple Owner
books.description: CoffeeScript recipes for the community by the community.

books.title: DOM Enlightenment
books.author: Cody Lindley
books.description: Exploring the relationship between JavaScript and the modern HTML DOM

books.title: Bootstrap, Responsive Web Development
books.author: Jake Spurlock
books.description: Discover how easy it is to design killer interfaces and responsive websites with the Bootstrap framework. This practical book gets you started building pages with Bootstrap’s HTML/CSS-based tools and design templates right away. You’ll also learn how to extend your app with interactive features, using its suite of jQuery plugins—often without writing a single line of code.

books.title: Art of Node
books.author: Max Odgen
books.description: a free short e-book that teaches you the fundamentals of Node.js by Max Odgen, a popular Node supporter

books.title: Stream handbook
books.author: James Halliday (substack)
books.description: a free short e-book that teaches you how to write node programs with streams, by James Halliday a famous NodeJS supporter that published numerous awesome NodeJS modules

books.title: JavaScript Succinctly
books.author: Cody Lindley
books.description: JavaScript Succinctly was written to give readers an accurate, concise examination of JavaScript objects and their supporting nuances, such as complex values, primitive values, scope, inheritance, the head object, and more. If you’re an intermediate JavaScript developer and want to solidify your understanding of the language, or if you’ve only used JavaScript beneath the mantle of libraries such as jQuery or Prototype, this is the book for you.

books.title: jQuery Succinctly
books.author: Cody Lindley
books.description: jQuery Succinctly was written to express, in short-order, the concepts essential to intermediate and advanced jQuery development. Its purpose is to instill in you, the reader, practices that jQuery developers take as common knowledge. Each chapter contains concepts essential to becoming a seasoned jQuery developer.

books.title: Knockout.js Succinctly
books.author: Ryan Hodson
books.description: Knockout.js Succinctly is intended for professional web developers who need to build dynamic, scalable user interfaces with minimal code. Author Ryan Hodson guides you through the essentials of the library, starting with a brief overview of Knockout and its data-oriented aspects, followed by a thorough examination of binding data to various HTML elements, and finally examples of accessing external data and combining Knockout with jQuery animation routines.

books.title: TypeScript Succinctly
books.author: Steve Fenton
books.description: With TypeScript Succinctly by Steve Fenton, you will learn how TypeScript provides optional static typing and classes to JavaScript development, how to create and load modules, and how to work with existing JavaScript libraries through ambient declarations. TypeScript is even significantly integrated with Visual Studio to provide the autocompletion and type checking you are most comfortable with.

books.title: AngularJS Fundamentals in 60 minutes
books.author: Dan Wahlin
books.description: This eBook is a documented transcription of the famous 'AngularJS in 60 minutes' video; The ebook is going through all of the key fundamentals you need to know about the AngularJS SPA framework.

books.title: JavaScript Allonge
books.author: Reginald Braithwaite
books.description: JavaScript Allongé is a book about programming with functions, because JavaScript is a programming language built on flexible and powerful functions.

books.title: jQuery Enlightenment
books.author: Cody Lindley
books.description: A book for jQuery developers who have surpassed the introductory concepts.

books.title: D3 Tips and Tricks
books.author: Malcolm Maclean
books.description: Over 430 pages of tips and tricks for using d3.js, one of the leading data visualization tools for the web. It's aimed at helping people get started and also includes loads of help for more complicated tasks.

books.title: Recipes with Angular.js
books.author: Frederik Dietz
books.description: Practical concepts and techniques for rapid web application development

books.title: Speaking Javascript
books.author: Axel Rauschmayer
books.description: Like it or not, JavaScript is everywhere these days—from browser to server to mobile—and now you, too, need to learn the language or dive deeper than you have. This concise book guides you into and through JavaScript, written by a veteran programmer who once found himself in the same position.

books.title: You Don't Know JS (series)
books.author: Kyle Simpson
books.description: Learn and deeply know *all* of JS (not just the 'good parts')

books.title: ECMAscript language reference
books.author: various authors
books.description: Learn all about the Javacript language specifications with this official ECMA-262 bible.

books.title: Human Javascript
books.author: Henrik Joreteg
books.description: Practical patterns for simple but powerful javascript apps. No magic frameworks. No monolithic toolkits. You're going to work with proper, real-life javascript in a way you'll understand, and with explanations that help you learn how to make great choices as you build your apps.

books.title: Understanding ECMAScript 6
books.author: Nicholas C. Zakas
books.description: ECMAScript 6 is coming, are you ready? There's a lot of new concepts to learn and understand. Get a headstart with this book!

books.title: Programming JavaScript Applications
books.author: Eric Elliott
books.description: Take advantage of JavaScript’s power to build robust web-scale or enterprise applications that are easy to extend and maintain.

books.title: Javascript Challenges
books.author: Tomas Corral
books.description: A book to challenge your knowledge about the most obscure parts of Javascript. Learn with us and don't be afraid again of Javascript.

books.title: Angular Succinctly
books.author: Frederik Dietz
books.description: Whether you are a novice looking to understand Angular.js or an expert seeking a reference guide, AngularJS Succinctly is indispensable!

books.title: The offline cookbook
books.author: Jake Archibald
books.description: Excellent overview and recipes using the current offline browsers capabilities

books.title: You Don't Know JS: Up & Going
books.author: Kyle Simpson
books.description: It’s easy to learn parts of JavaScript, but much harder to learn it completely—or even sufficiently—whether you’re new to the language or have used it for years. With the 'You Don’t Know JS' book series, you’ll get a more complete understanding of JavaScript, including trickier parts of the language that many experienced...

books.title: Felix's Node.js Guide
books.author: Felix Geisendörfer
books.description: Node.js Beginner Guide and Style Guide. The guide is a work in progress by Felix Geisendörfer, an early Node.js core contributor.

books.title: Exploring ES6
books.author: Axel Rauschmayer
books.description: Upgrade to the next version of JavaScript

books.title: SurviveJS - Webpack
books.author: Juho Vepsäläinen
books.description: Learn to understand Webpack, the bundler.

books.title: SurviveJS - React
books.author: Juho Vepsäläinen
books.description: Learn how to build a Kanban application using React.

books.title: Mostly adequate guide to functional programming
books.author: Brian Lonsdorf (DrBoolean)
books.description: Pure Happiness with Pure Functions

books.title: The introduction to Reactive Programming you've been missing
books.author: André Staltz (andrestaltz)
books.description: So you're curious in learning this new thing called Reactive Programming, particularly its variant comprising of Rx, Bacon.js, RAC, and others.

books.title: Book on Building Front-End Web Apps with Plain JavaScript
books.author: Gerd Wagner
books.description: This book shows how to build front-end web applications with plain JavaScript, not using any (third-party) framework or library.

books.title: AngularJS Directives in Traction
books.author: Amit Gharat
books.description: This eBook helps you understand how built-in directives work and teaches you to build custom directives on your own.

books.title: Thinking in Javascript
books.author: Aravind Shenoy
books.description: [registration] Get started with JavaScript with this free eBook and learn one of the most important languages in web development today. With helpful tips and code examples, discover how you can create websites with impressive and dynamic functionality. Explore JavaScript’s in-built features and find out how to customize them in this accessible and free guide.

books.title: What You Need to Know about JavaScript
books.author: Gabriel Cánepa
books.description: [registration] Discover everything a beginner needs to know about the world of JavaScript with this free eBook. From the absolute basics of JS syntax to combining ECMAScript 6 and Visual Studio Code this primer is the perfect resource for a JavaScript Master-in-the-Making!

books.title: Exploring ES2016 and ES2017
books.author: Dr. Axel Rauschmayer
books.description: “Exploring ES2016 and ES2017” is a living book. Much content is still to come! Buy it to stay up to date on what is in ECMAScript 2016 and ECMAScript 2017

books.title: Practical ES6 [modular javascript]
books.author: Nicolás Bevacqua
books.description: Ideal for professional software developers with a basic understanding of JavaScript, this practical book shows you how to build small, interconnected ES6 JavaScript modules that emphasize reusability. You’ll learn how to face a project with a modular mindset, and how to organize your applications into simple pieces that work well in isolation and can be combined to create a large, robust application.

books.title: Designing Scalable JavaScript Applications
books.author: Emmit Scott
books.description: [registration] Designing Scalable JavaScript Applications helps you start thinking about which tools and frameworks you’ll use and which design patterns you’ll implement. This book brings together excerpts from four different Manning titles selected by Emmit Scott.

books.title: Using the Web to Build the IoT
books.author: Dominique D. Guinard and Vlad Trifa
books.description: [registration] Using the Web to Build the IoT is a collection of six hand-picked chapters that introduce the key technologies and concepts for building the application layer of the IoT.

books.title: AngularJS essentials
books.author: Rodrigo Blanas
books.description: [registration] Discover the best practices of the AngularJS framework and its most important concepts such as AngularJS directives, expressions, filters, and modules. This free eBook guides you through the steps of building your very own web application with AngularJS.

books.title: HTML5 Data Visualization
books.author: Ben Fhala
books.description: [registration] Get a complete grounding in the exciting visual world of Canvas and HTML5 using this recipe-packed cookbook. Learn to create charts and graphs, draw complex shapes, add interactivity, work with Google maps, and much more.

books.title: Instant MongoDB Starter Guide
books.author: Amol Nayak
books.description: [registration] This free MongoDB eBook is designed to get you working with MongoDB as quickly as possible. Starting with installation and setup, we quickly show you how to start importing your data into the database. Learn about CRUD operations in MongoDB, its Map Reduce support, schema design, performance tuning operations, and more.

books.title: Mastering Javascript high performance
books.author: Chad R. Adams
books.description: [registration] Studying JavaScript performance in depth will make you capable of tackling the complex and important tasks required to solve performance issues. With this full-length free eBook, discover how to optimize your JavaScript for both mobile and web applications.

books.title: Thinking in HTML
books.author: Aravind Shenoy
books.description: [registration] Learn to write intutive HTML and build your sites on solid foundations

books.title: What You Need To Know About Node.js
books.author: Bruno Joseph Dmello
books.description: [registration] Dive into fundamentals of Node.js

books.title: Object-Oriented JavaScript - Second Edition
books.author: Stoyan Stefanov & Kumar Chetan Sharma
books.description: [registration] Learn everything you need to know about OOJS in this comprehensive guide

books.title: The Road to learn React
books.author: Robin Wieruch
books.description: [registration] Your journey to master plain React with practical experiences

books.title: JavaScript, ¡Inspírate!
books.author: Ulises Gascón González
books.description: [ES] Un libro de programación sencillo y divertido que nos muestra como programar en JavaScript, desde pseudocódigo hasta las peticiones AJAX.

books.title: The JavaScript Way
books.author: Baptiste Pesquet
books.description: A modern introduction to an essential language: beginner-friendly yet comprehensive, standards-aligned, hands-on and easy to follow.

books.title: Learning ECMAScript 6
books.author: Narayan Prusty
books.description: [registration] Rethink the way you develop with JavaScript by learning the ECMA standardized scripting language that lies at its foundations – ECMAScript 6!
